prompts: I get home at 7 pm and need dinner on the table in 20 minutes. I’ve got boneless chicken thighs, broccoli, soy sauce, garlic, and rice. Please give me one simple, tasty recipe (with rough quantities and 4–6 steps) that uses one pan plus the rice cooker.

I’m vegetarian and short on time—can you suggest two quick weeknight dinners I can make in under 25 minutes using pantry items I have: canned black beans, canned tomatoes, baby spinach, pasta, eggs, and cheddar? Include brief instructions and key seasoning ideas.

I want to meal prep on Sunday for Mon–Fri with high-protein meals around 500–600 calories per serving. I can only cook twice this week and I’ll be reheating in a microwave. I have: chicken thighs, canned black beans, brown rice, sweet potatoes, bell peppers, red onion, spinach, Greek yogurt, eggs, oats, peanut butter, soy sauce, sriracha, olive oil, and basic spices. No seafood. Give me 4 concise meal prep ideas (2 lunches, 2 dinners) using mostly what I have, with brief cook steps and how to store.

Can you suggest vegetarian meal prep ideas for make-ahead breakfasts and snacks for 4 days? I only have a fridge and microwave (no stove or oven), like Mediterranean flavors, and want to keep it under $30. Please give 5 ideas that need minimal prep and a short shopping list with approximate quantities.

Create a quick vegetarian main for two using: 1 large sweet potato, 1 can black beans (rinsed), 1 red bell pepper, 1 small onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 lime, salt, pepper, and olive oil. I need an ingredient list with quantities and 6–8 concise steps. Ready in about 30 minutes, gluten-free, and suggest a simple garnish or side.

I want a lighter vegetarian lasagna for a weeknight. Can you outline a mushroom–spinach lasagna that serves 4, with fewer cheeses (prefer ricotta + a little mozzarella), no meat, and lots of vegetables? Please list the components for each layer, brief prep instructions, bake temperature/time, and one tip to prevent it from getting watery.

I’ve got a can of chickpeas, a bag of spinach, 1 onion, 2 cloves of garlic, a can of diced tomatoes, and dried pasta. I also have olive oil, salt, pepper, smoked paprika, chili flakes, and dried oregano. Can you give me a quick vegan dinner recipe (serves 2) that uses these, takes about 25–30 minutes, and includes exact measurements and simple steps?

Please write a high-protein vegan breakfast recipe for two people that’s around 450–500 calories per serving. I’d like it to feature rolled oats and mixed berries, and I have vanilla plant protein powder and almond milk. Provide a short ingredient list with gram/cup measures and concise instructions.

I’m strictly gluten-free and need quick dinner ideas. I’ve got: chicken thighs, broccoli, quinoa, canned diced tomatoes, feta, lemons, garlic, olive oil, smoked paprika, cumin, oregano, and chili flakes. Can you suggest two simple gluten-free meals I can make tonight with brief steps?

Can you convert this banana bread to a gluten-free version with exact ingredient substitutions and any tweaks to time/temperature? Classic Banana Bread (1 loaf): 1½ cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, ½ tsp salt, 3 ripe bananas (mashed), ¾ cup sugar, 1 large egg, ⅓ cup melted butter, 1 tsp vanilla. Mix wet + dry, combine, pour into greased 9x5 pan, bake at 350°F for 55–60 minutes. I have a 1:1 gluten-free flour blend, almond flour, cornstarch, and xanthan gum.

Help me convert this banana bread to be completely dairy-free while keeping a similar texture and flavor. Suggest specific substitute ingredients and amounts, and note any bake-time changes.

Current recipe (makes one loaf):
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 3 ripe bananas, mashed
- 3/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup whole milk
Optional: 1/2 cup chocolate chips
At a coffee shop, what are the best dairy-free milk options for a latte, and how do they differ in taste and foam? I usually like slightly sweet, smooth lattes and decent latte art.

Using only these ingredients I have on hand—eggs, chicken thighs, canned tuna, zucchini, cauliflower rice, spinach, cherry tomatoes, red onion, cheddar cheese, plain unsweetened Greek yogurt, olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, and oregano—suggest 2 quick low-carb dinners (15g net carbs or less per serving). Please include brief steps and an estimated net carb count per serving.

I love spaghetti bolognese—can you give me a low-carb version for two people? Offer two noodle alternatives (e.g., zucchini noodles vs. shirataki), a simple sauce recipe, and rough net carbs per serving. Keep it beginner-friendly and under 20g net carbs.
I need 2 high-protein vegetarian dinners I can cook in under 30 minutes. For each, give ingredients for 2 servings, approximate protein per serving, and brief steps.

I’ve got chicken breast, canned chickpeas, Greek yogurt, baby spinach, lemon, cumin, garlic, and jasmine rice. Suggest one high-protein one-pot dish for two servings with quantities and short instructions.

I’ve got about $10 to feed two adults tonight. Pantry/fridge: 2 cups dry rice, 1 can chickpeas, 2 onions, frozen spinach, garlic, spices (cumin, paprika, chili flakes), a lemon, and 4 eggs. No dairy. Can you suggest one budget-friendly dinner using mostly these, with simple steps and an approximate cook time? Keep it under 10 ingredients total and, if absolutely necessary, add only 1 low-cost item (under $2) from the store.

I’m a college student with only a microwave and a single hot plate. I need a cheap make-ahead lunch for 3 days using canned tuna and pasta, total budget around $7. I can buy one vegetable. Please give me one recipe with an ingredient list, simple steps, and a rough per-serving cost. Avoid mayo and nuts.

Can you help me make a quick one-pot vegetarian dinner for 4 using what I have on hand? Pantry/fridge: 1 can chickpeas, 1 can crushed tomatoes (14 oz), 1 can coconut milk (13.5 oz), 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 4 cups baby spinach, 1 cup basmati rice, spices (cumin, curry powder, chili flakes), olive oil, salt, pepper, and a lemon. Please give me a 25–30 minute recipe with ingredient amounts and clear steps, all in one pot (no separate rice cooking), plus a quick note on how to avoid mushy rice.

I'm cooking on a single-burner camp stove with one 3-quart pot. Can you give me a simple one-pot chicken and rice recipe (serves 3–4) using these exact items: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs, 1 cup long-grain white rice, 2 cups chicken broth, 1 small onion, 1 carrot, 1/2 cup frozen peas, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp paprika, salt, pepper, and 2 tbsp oil. Please include precise measurements, step-by-step timing, and one tip for preventing the rice from sticking. No oven and no extra pans.

Can you give me a kid-friendly sheet pan chicken dinner for a busy weeknight? I need to feed 4 and I have: bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs; 2 sweet potatoes; 1 head broccoli; 1 red onion; garlic; lemon; olive oil; salt; pepper; smoked paprika; dried oregano; honey; and Dijon. Please include oven temp, how to stagger the veggies so the broccoli doesn’t overcook, about how long total (ideally 40 minutes or less), and a quick pan sauce or dipping sauce using what I listed. Not spicy, please, and I’d like crispy edges.

Help me make a vegetarian sheet pan dinner that’s high-protein and gluten-free. On hand: extra-firm tofu, Brussels sprouts, 1 red bell pepper, a large carrot, 1 can chickpeas, cornstarch, maple syrup, tamari, rice vinegar, garlic, and sesame oil. Give me concise steps for pressing and seasoning the tofu, oven temperature, timing (including when to add each veg so nothing burns), and a simple maple-soy glaze to toss at the end. Serves 2–3, mildly spiced only.

I’ve got a 4-quart slow cooker and these on hand: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs, 1 can black beans (drained), 1 cup frozen corn, 1 can diced tomatoes, 1 small onion, 1 packet taco seasoning, and 3 cups chicken broth. Can you give me a simple slow cooker chicken taco soup using only those (plus salt/pepper), with cook time on LOW, and quick serving suggestions? Keep it concise.

I want a vegetarian slow cooker lentil curry I can start in the morning and eat by dinner. I have: 1 cup dry brown lentils (rinsed), 1 can coconut milk, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 2 carrots, a few handfuls of spinach, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, curry powder, cumin, and vegetable stock. Please give an ingredient list with quantities for 4 servings, brief step-by-step instructions, and a note on how to make it mildly spicy without making it bitter.

I’ve got an Instant Pot and these ingredients: boneless skin-on chicken thighs, jasmine rice, canned diced tomatoes, onion, garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, and chicken broth. Can you give me a simple one-pot chicken and rice recipe for 4 people with specific sauté/pressure cook times, pressure level, and a quick vs. natural release note? Ideally done in under 40 minutes.

I’m vegan and want to make a creamy Instant Pot butternut squash soup without coconut milk. I have: butternut squash, vegetable broth, onion, carrot, raw cashews, fresh sage, thyme, black pepper, and a lemon. Can you give step-by-step instructions with sauté time, pressure cook time and release, and how to blend and finish the seasoning?

I’m a college student with a tiny air fryer and limited groceries. Using only these ingredients—eggs, bread, cheddar cheese, potatoes, carrots, a can of chickpeas, olive oil, garlic powder, smoked paprika, honey, and soy sauce—can you give me 3 quick air fryer snack ideas? Please include temp, time, and 1–2 sentence steps for each.

How can I make extra-crispy tofu in the air fryer with minimal oil? I have firm tofu, cornstarch, soy sauce, sesame oil, and garlic powder. Please give exact pressing/coating steps, temp and time (including shake/flip points), how to prevent sticking, and a super quick dipping sauce idea.

I’ve got two 1.5-inch ribeye steaks and a Weber Spirit gas grill. I want medium-rare. Can you give me a simple step-by-step plan with grill preheat temp, whether to use a two-zone setup, how long per side, when to flip, target internal temps, and how long to rest? I’ve got kosher salt, black pepper, avocado oil, and a decent instant-read thermometer.

How should I grill/smoke bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs on a 22" charcoal kettle using a two-zone fire? I have apple and hickory chunks, a basic rub (salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder), and bottled BBQ sauce. Please suggest the target grate temp, wood choice, when to sauce, about how long it’ll take, and how to get crispy skin without drying the meat.

Can you give me a quick chicken and broccoli stir-fry recipe for two using only these ingredients: chicken breast (8 oz), frozen broccoli florets, soy sauce, garlic, ginger paste, cornstarch, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes? Please include marinade and sauce measurements (in tsp/Tbsp), the cooking steps, and total time (aim for under 25 minutes).

Hey! I want a vegan tofu and veggie stir-fry over rice. I have firm tofu, bell pepper, snap peas, carrots, mushrooms, scallions, low-sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, maple syrup, cornstarch, garlic, and chili-garlic sauce. I avoid sesame and nuts. How should I press and pan-fry the tofu so it stays crispy, what order should I add the veggies, and could you give a simple sauce with exact amounts for 2 servings?

Can you give me a simple stovetop chicken tortilla soup for 4 using rotisserie chicken? I have: canned diced tomatoes, black beans, frozen corn, onion, garlic, chicken broth, lime, cilantro, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and tortilla chips (no tortillas). Please include exact ingredient amounts, steps (30–40 minutes total), where to add heat (I have jalapeño and hot sauce), and 2–3 topping ideas.

My beef stew came out thin and kind of bland after a long simmer. I don't want to cook it much longer. On hand: tomato paste, soy sauce, fish sauce, Worcestershire, balsamic, red wine, cornstarch, flour, butter, and a microwave. What's the fastest way to thicken the sauce and boost savory depth without making it salty or gummy?

Can you help me throw together a crunchy chopped salad for lunch using what I have? I’d like 1 serving, gluten-free, roughly 500 calories. On hand: romaine, red cabbage, cucumber, carrot, canned chickpeas, avocado, green onion, cilantro, toasted peanuts, sesame seeds. Pantry: olive oil, sesame oil, rice vinegar, tamari (gluten-free soy sauce), lime, honey, Dijon, garlic, ginger, salt, pepper. Please provide: (1) an ingredient list with gram/teaspoon amounts, (2) a separate quick sesame-ginger dressing yielding about 2–3 tbsp, and (3) 3–4 short steps. Keep the total ingredient count under 10.

I’ve got leftover roasted beets (about 2 cups), a small log of goat cheese, a bag of arugula, and some walnuts. Can you suggest a simple salad for 2 that uses those, with a basic balsamic vinaigrette? Please include precise quantities and a 3-step method, and keep it not overly sweet.
I’ve got 2 eggs, a handful of spinach, some feta, a few cherry tomatoes, and one slice of sourdough. What’s a quick 10-minute breakfast I can make with brief steps?
What’s the difference between a frittata and a quiche, and which would be better for a lazy Sunday brunch for two if I don’t have special equipment like a pie dish?

My 6-year-old is a picky eater. Please suggest 5 nut-free, dairy-free school lunchbox ideas that don’t require reheating and won’t get soggy by noon. He’ll eat chicken, rice, berries, cucumbers, and hummus but no tomatoes or spicy foods. Include a main, a fruit/veg, and a fun but low-sugar snack for each idea.

I’m trying to pack healthy work lunches. Can you give me 4 high-protein vegetarian lunchbox ideas I can batch-prep on Sunday? I won’t have a microwave, so cold-friendly meals only, around 450–550 calories each. Please list key components and a short prep note for each.

Hosting a casual potluck tonight. I need 3 vegetarian, gluten-free finger foods I can make in 30 minutes or less using mostly what I have: canned chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, feta, yogurt, lemons, garlic, corn tortillas, hummus, olives, parsley, eggs, frozen spinach, and pantry basics. I have an oven and stovetop. Please give brief instructions and quantities for 8 people.

I want one make-ahead appetizer dip for game day that I can keep warm in a small slow cooker and serve with chips and veggie sticks. I have cream cheese, sour cream, canned green chiles, shredded cheddar, rotisserie chicken, and taco seasoning. Please provide a concise ingredient list, steps, and a tip to prevent it from getting greasy or splitting.
I'm going on a road trip and need portable, no-refrigeration snacks. Please give me 6 healthy, high-protein ideas under 250 calories each, with a one-sentence prep or portion note for each.

Here’s what I have on hand: Greek yogurt, chickpeas, cucumbers, almond butter, rolled oats, apples, canned tuna, whole-wheat tortillas, baby carrots, and hummus. Suggest 3 healthy snacks I can make in under 10 minutes, with quick steps and rough portion sizes.
I’ve got strawberries, Greek yogurt, honey, rolled oats, and a lemon. Give me a quick, no-bake dessert idea for two with simple steps and approximate quantities. Keep it under 150 words.
What’s the difference between French macarons and coconut macaroons? Explain in a few bullet points covering key ingredients, texture, typical flavors, and add one tip for storing each.

I’ve got 1 cup almond flour, 1 egg, 1/3 cup sugar, butter, vanilla, and chocolate chips. Can you give me a small-batch (8–10 cookies) recipe for soft chocolate chip cookies using these? Keep instructions to 6 steps max, and include oven temp and bake time.

My lemon bars came out with a soggy crust and the lemon filling separated. Here's what I did: crust—1 cup flour, 1/4 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 cup melted butter; pressed into 8x8 pan and baked 10 min at 325°F. Filling—3 eggs, 1 cup sugar, 2 tbsp flour, 1/3 cup lemon juice; whisked and poured onto hot crust; baked 20 min at 325°F; cooled 1 hour. Bars were gooey in the middle and watery on top. What likely went wrong and how can I fix it next time? Keep the advice concise with 5–6 bullet points.

I’ve got these ingredients on hand: almond flour, eggs, granulated sugar, unsalted butter, blueberries (fresh), baking powder, vanilla extract, salt, and one lemon. Can you give me a simple gluten-free blueberry cupcake recipe for 12 cupcakes, with ingredient amounts in grams/ml, baking temperature/time, and the basic steps?

I’m bringing 12 chocolate cupcakes to a kids’ pirate-themed birthday. Can you suggest three easy decorating ideas using supermarket items (like frosting, candies, or sprinkles) and give quick instructions for each?

I'm brand new to bread baking. Can you briefly explain what each of the four basics—flour, water, yeast, and salt—does in a simple yeast bread? Also, what's a good beginner hydration and salt percentage to aim for?

My basic white sandwich loaf came out gummy inside even after cooling for 2 hours. Details: baked at 350°F for 35 minutes in a 9×5 pan, dough at ~60% hydration with instant yeast, one 60-minute bulk rise and a 30-minute final proof. What are the most likely causes and a couple quick fixes I can try next time?

I’ve got these ingredients on hand: extra-virgin olive oil, lemons, limes, garlic, shallot, fresh parsley, cilantro, honey, Dijon mustard, soy sauce, rice vinegar, apple cider vinegar, smoked paprika, ground cumin, red pepper flakes, peanut butter, black pepper, and salt. Can you suggest two different quick sauces or condiments that pair well with grilled chicken and roasted vegetables? Please include exact measurements for about 1/2 cup each and 5-minute directions. No dairy or sesame.

Help—my homemade mayo split. I used 1 large egg straight from the fridge, 1 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1 tsp Dijon, 1 tbsp lemon juice, and a pinch of salt. I tried the immersion blender method in a wide-mouth jar and ended up with a thin, soupy mixture that won’t thicken. How can I rescue what I have right now, step by step, with minimal extra ingredients? Also, what should I change next time to avoid splitting?

Hey, weeknight dinner help: I’ve got 1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs, soy sauce, honey, garlic, lime, and sesame oil. Can you give me a quick marinade with exact measurements (in tablespoons/teaspoons), how long to marinate if I only have 25–30 minutes, and brief broiler cooking tips so the honey doesn’t burn? Keep it moderately salty and family-friendly.

I’m smoking a 5 lb pork shoulder tomorrow and want a dry rub that leans savory with ground coffee and chili powder but isn’t very sweet. Please give me the rub ratios with salt specified (by teaspoons or grams), how much total rub to make, when to apply it, and an optional spritz mixture to use during the cook.

How do I get ultra-crispy skin on salmon when using a stainless-steel pan? Walk me through the steps from prep to plating—how to dry/season, what oil to use, heat level, when to press or flip, and how to tell it’s done—so it doesn’t stick or overcook.

My roasted vegetables always turn out soft and steamy instead of browned and crisp. What techniques should I use for better caramelization? Please cover cut size, oil and salt timing, pan material, spacing, oven temperature, and whether to use convection. I’m using a standard sheet pan and parchment.

I’m making banana bread tonight, but I need it to be both egg-free and dairy-free. The recipe calls for 2 large eggs and 1/2 cup unsalted butter. I have ripe bananas, vegetable oil, coconut oil, unsweetened applesauce, ground flaxseed, oat milk, and almond milk. What are the best substitutions (with amounts) to keep the loaf moist and not too dense?

My teriyaki sauce recipe calls for 1/4 cup mirin, but I don’t have any. I do have sake, rice vinegar, white wine, apple juice, and granulated sugar. What’s the closest-tasting substitute I can mix up, and how should I adjust sweetness and acidity for that 1/4 cup mirin portion?

Fridge clean-out help: I’ve got about 1.5 cups shredded rotisserie chicken, 1 cup roasted sweet potato cubes, half a can of black beans, 2 corn tortillas, a small handful of crumbled goat cheese, cilantro, and a lime. I also have pantry basics (onion, garlic, spices, olive oil). Can you suggest two creative dinners that use most of this in under 25 minutes, with brief step-by-step instructions?

Leftovers challenge: I have ~2 cups cooked white rice, a container of roasted broccoli florets, and a small piece of grilled salmon. I also have eggs, scallions, soy sauce, and panko. I don’t want regular fried rice—can you give me two inventive ways to repurpose these (skillet and oven available), with concise directions?

Design a cozy Christmas Eve dinner menu for 8 adults. Constraints: one vegetarian guest and one severe tree nut allergy (avoid all tree nuts; peanuts are okay). Please include: 1 appetizer, 1 main with two sides, a dedicated vegetarian main, 1 dessert, and a nonalcoholic drink pairing. Use winter seasonal ingredients available in the U.S. Add quick make-ahead notes (what to prep the day before vs. day-of) and a concise shopping list grouped by department. No recipes—just brief dish descriptions.

I’m hosting a New Year’s Eve apartment gathering for 6 from 8–11 pm. Can you propose a small-plates + drinks menu with: 4 bite-sized dishes (at least one vegan and one gluten-free), 2 cocktails plus 1 zero-proof drink, and a simple dessert? Keep total prep under 90 minutes using mostly supermarket items. Please include short serving tips and a quick timeline (e.g., what to do the morning of vs. right before guests arrive).
